DataElement.preferredName: Hyperthermia Cumulative Equivalent Minute Tenth Percentile Temperature Celsius Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Maximum temperature reached at the Hyperthermia thermal dose, defined by the cumulative equivalent minutes at 43 degrees C for the 10th percentile of the temperature distribution (CEM 43oCT90).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hyperthermia Cumulative Equivalent Minute Tenth Percentile Temperature
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Hyperthermia thermal dose, defined by the cumulative equivalent minutes at 43 degrees C for the 10th percentile of the temperature distribution (CEM 43oCT90).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition that manifests with abnormally high body temperature. In hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production, e.g. in heat stroke, malignant hyperthermia, endocrine hyperthermia, or neuroleptic malignant syndrome. The concept does not refer to hyperpyrexia, the state when the hypothalamic set-point is reset at a higher temperature and is physiologically regulated.

Concepts.definition: A condition characterized by an abnormally high body temperature. In a hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production.

Property.preferredName: Cumulative Equivalent Minute Tenth percentile Temperature
Property.preferredDefinition: Increasing by successive addition.:A person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc; being essentially equal to something.:A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:No Value Exists:the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment.

Concepts.definition: A person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc.; being essentially equal to something.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Maximum or highest celsius recorded for a person.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a concept of quantity derived from zero and units.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D for ThermoDox trial.
